flawed_nl_solution:
If the number of candies was 300, and 40/100 percent were sour, then there were 40/100*300 =<<40/100*300=1500/2>>1500/2 sour candies.
The number of good candies was 300-1500/2=<<300-1500/2=-450>>-450
The number of people who received candy is Henley, 1+ 2 brothers = <<1+2=3>>3 people
if they divided the good candies equally, each person got -450/3 = <<-450/3=-150>>-150 candies.
#### -150

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 120, not 1500/2. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
